name: cmm-cessda
displayName: CESSDA Metadata Model

name: name
displayName: description

name: cmm-geographicCoverage
displayName: Information on the geographic coverage of the data. Includes the total geographic scope of the data.

name: cmm-country
displayName: The country or nation that the Dataset is about.

name: cmm-state
displayName: The state or province that the Dataset is about. Use GeoNames for correct spelling and avoid abbreviations.

name: cmm-city
displayName: The name of the city that the Dataset is about. Use GeoNames for correct spelling and avoid abbreviations.

name: cmm-otherGeographicCoverage
displayName: Other information on the geographic coverage of the data.

name: cmm-geographicUnit
displayName: Lowest level of geographic aggregation covered by the Dataset, e.g., village, county, region.

name: cmm-geographicBoundingBox
displayName: The fundamental geometric description for any Dataset that models geography is the geographic bounding box. It describes the minimum box, defined by west and east longitudes and north and south latitudes, which includes the largest geographic extent of the Dataset's geographic coverage. This element is used in the first pass of a coordinate-based search. Inclusion of this element in the codebook is recommended, but is required if the bound polygon box is included.

name: cmm-westLongitude
displayName: Westernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values, expressed in decimal degrees, is -180,0 <= West Bounding Longitude Value <= 180,0.

name: cmm-eastLongitude
displayName: Easternmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values, expressed in decimal degrees, is -180,0 <= East Bounding Longitude Value <= 180,0.

name: cmm-northLongitude
displayName: Northernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values, expressed in decimal degrees, is -90,0 <= North Bounding Latitude Value <= 90,0.

name: cmm-southLongitude
displayName: Southernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values, expressed in decimal degrees, is -90,0 <= South Bounding Latitude Value <= 90,0.

name: cmm-unitOfAnalysis-cv
displayName: Basic unit of analysis or observation that this Dataset describes. Select from the available options in the DDI Controlled Vocabularies for Analysis Unit.

name: cmm-unitOfAnalysis-vocabulary
displayName: The controlled vocabulary that is used.

name: cmm-unitOfAnalysis-term
displayName: The term picked from the controlled vocabulary.

name: cmm-unitOfAnalysis-url
displayName: The URL for the term chosen from the vocabulary.

name: cmm-universe
displayName: Description of the population covered by the data in the file; the group of people or other elements that are the object of the study and to which the study results refer. Age, nationality, and residence commonly help to delineate a given universe, but any number of other factors may be used, such as age limits, sex, marital status, race, ethnic group, nationality, income, veteran status, criminal convictions, and more. The universe may consist of elements other than persons, such as housing units, court cases, deaths, countries, and so on. In general, it should be possible to tell from the description of the universe whether a given individual or element is a member of the population under study. Also known as the universe of interest, population of interest, and target population.

name: cmm-timeMethod-cv
displayName: The time method or time dimension of the data collection. Select from the available options in the DDI Controlled Vocabularies for Time method.

name: cmm-timeMethod-vocabulary
displayName: The controlled vocabulary that is used.

name: cmm-timeMethod-term
displayName: The term picked from the controlled vocabulary.

name: cmm-timeMethod-url
displayName: The URL for the term chosen from the vocabulary.

name: cmm-dataCollector
displayName: Individual, agency or organization responsible for administering the questionnaire or interview or compiling the data.

name: cmm-frequencyOfDataCollection
displayName: If the data collected includes more than one point in time, indicate the frequency with which the data was collected; that is, monthly, quarterly, or other.

name: cmm-samplingProcedure-cv
displayName: Type of sample and sample design used to select the survey respondents to represent the population. Select from the available options in the DDI Controlled Vocabularies for Sampling Procedure.

name: cmm-samplingProcedure-vocabulary
displayName: The controlled vocabulary that is used.

name: cmm-samplingProcedure-term
displayName: The term picked from the controlled vocabulary.

name: cmm-samplingProcedure-url
displayName: The URL for the term chosen from the vocabulary.

name: cmm-samplingProcedureFreeText
displayName: Type of sample and sample design used to select the survey respondents to represent the population.

name: cmm-targetSampleSize
displayName: Specific information regarding the target sample size, actual sample size, and the formula used to determine this.

name: cmm-targetSampleActualSize
displayName: Actual sample size.

name: cmm-targetSampleSizeFormula
displayName: Formula used to determine target sample size.

name: cmm-deviationsFromSampleDesign
displayName: Show correspondence as well as discrepancies between the sampled units (obtained) and available statistics for the population (age, sex-ratio, marital status, etc.) as a whole.

name: cmm-collectionMode-cv
displayName: Method used to collect the data; instrumentation characteristics. Select from the available options in the DDI Controlled Vocabularies for Mode of Collection.

name: cmm-collectionMode-vocabulary
displayName: The controlled vocabulary that is used.

name: cmm-collectionMode-term
displayName: The term picked from the controlled vocabulary.

name: cmm-collectionMode-url
displayName: The URL for the term chosen from the vocabulary.

name: cmm-researchInstrument-cv
displayName: Type of data collection instrument used. Select from the available options in the DDI Controlled Vocabularies for Type of Instrument.

name: cmm-researchInstrument-vocabulary
displayName: The controlled vocabulary that is used.

name: cmm-researchInstrument-term
displayName: The term picked from the controlled vocabulary.

name: cmm-researchInstrument-url
displayName: The URL for the term chosen from the vocabulary.

name: cmm-dataCollectionSituation
displayName: Description of noteworthy aspects of the data collection situation. Includes information on factors such as cooperativeness of respondents, duration of interviews, number of call backs, or similar.

name: cmm-actionsToMinimizeLoss
displayName: Summary of actions taken to minimize data loss. Include information on actions such as follow-up visits, supervisory checks, historical matching, estimation, and so on.

name: cmm-controlOperations
displayName: Control OperationsMethods to facilitate data control performed by the primary investigator or by the data archive.

name: cmm-weighting
displayName: The use of sampling procedures might make it necessary to apply weights to produce accurate statistical results. Describes the criteria for using weights in analysis of a collection. If a weighting formula or coefficient was developed, the formula is provided, its elements are defined, and it is indicated how the formula was applied to the data.

name: cmm-cleaningOperations
displayName: Methods used to clean the data collection, such as consistency checking, wildcode checking, or other.

name: cmm-responseRate
displayName: Percentage of sample members who provided information.
